pulsesuite.libpulsesuite.calcintlength¶

Provides high-performance integer and double length calculation utilities, matching Fortran’s intlength module, using NumPy, Numba, and NumericTypes.

This module is optimized for scientific computing and high-performance clusters, supporting batch operations on large arrays.

Author: Rahul R. Sah

Module Contents¶

Classes¶

IntLengthCalculator

Calculator for determining the string length of integer and floating-point numbers, similar to Fortran's intlength module.
class pulsesuite.libpulsesuite.calcintlength.IntLengthCalculator¶

Calculator for determining the string length of integer and floating-point numbers, similar to Fortran’s intlength module. Uses NumPy, Numba, and NumericTypes for performance and precision.

CalcIntLength(i: int | np.ndarray) → int | np.ndarray¶

Calculates the number of characters needed to represent an integer or array of integers.

CalcDblLength(x: float | np.ndarray, p: int, e: int, frmt: str) → int | np.ndarray¶

Calculates the number of characters needed to represent a float or array of floats in a given format.

BatchContext():

Context manager for efficient batch operations on large datasets.

class BatchContext¶

Bases: ContextManager

Context manager for efficient batch operations on large datasets. Use this context to ensure memory locality and optimal performance on HPC clusters.

Examples

>>> with IntLengthCalculator.BatchContext():
...     result = IntLengthCalculator.CalcIntLength(np.arange(-1000000, 1000000))
...
__enter__() → IntLengthCalculator¶

Return self upon entering the runtime context.

__exit__(exc_type, exc_val, exc_tb) → bool | None¶

Raise any exception triggered within the runtime context.

classmethod calcIntLength(i: int | numpy.ndarray) → int | numpy.ndarray¶

Calculates the number of characters needed to represent an integer or array of integers, including sign if negative.

Parameters:

i (int or np.ndarray) – The integer or array of integers to evaluate.

Returns:

The number of characters needed to represent the integer(s) as string(s).

Return type:

int or np.ndarray

classmethod calcDblLength(x: float | numpy.ndarray, p: int, e: int, frmt: str) → int | numpy.ndarray¶

Calculates the number of characters needed to represent a floating-point number or array in a given format.

Parameters:

  • x (float or np.ndarray) – The floating-point number or array to evaluate.

  • p (int) – Precision (number of digits after decimal).

  • e (int) – Exponent width.

  • frmt (str) – Format specifier (“ES”, “EN”, “E”, or “D”).

Returns:

The number of characters needed to represent the float(s) as string(s).

Return type:

int or np.ndarray
